question: Which team will win the 2025 Six Nations Championship?
description:
The [Six Nations Championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_Nations_Championship "Six Nations Championship") is an annual rugby union competition among England, France, Ireland, Italy, Scotland, and Wales. Each team plays the others once, and the champion is determined by match points and standard rugby tiebreakers. ([points difference and then tries scored](https://www.sixnationsrugby.com/en/m6n/championship-rules "points difference and then tries scored"))

The last winners have been:

| Year | Winner  |
| ---- | ------- |
| 2024 | Ireland |
| 2023 | Ireland |
| 2022 | France  |
| 2021 | Wales   |
| 2020 | England |
fine_print: If two teams end up ex aequo as first place and no single winner is decided by the official organizer, this question will resolve as ambiguous.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Italy Triumphs Over Wales at Six Nations 2025**
Italy secured their first win at the 2025 Six Nations Championship, defeating Wales 22-15 at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. The Azzurri, led by coach Quesada, dominated the match, with Ange Capuozzo's try proving decisive. The win, which came after a 31-19 loss to Scotland, earns Italy 4 points. Italy will face a tough test next, as they host France on February 23 at the Stadio Olimpico. 'It was a great day,' said the Italian team, as they celebrated their much-needed victory. 'We played with a lot of heart and determination, and it paid off in the end.'

**Six Nations 2025: Scotland vs Ireland preview, kick-off time, team news, BBC coverage & match facts**
Scotland will face Ireland in the Six Nations 2025, seeking to end a 10-match losing streak against the defending champions. Scotland's last win in this fixture was in 2017 under Vern Cotter, while all their defeats since have been during Gregor Townsend's reign. Ireland, who kicked off their title defence with a bonus-point victory over England, are buoyed by their impressive recent record of 13 wins from their last 14 Six Nations fixtures. According to BBC, Scotland will be looking to lay down a marker in their search for a first Six Nations title. 'The Irish are seemingly unaffected by the absence of their head coach Andy Farrell, who is on British and Irish Lions duty,' said the BBC. 'Ireland's impressive recent record, however, suggests they will be a tough opponent for Scotland.'

**England v France, Six Nations 2025: What time is kick-off today and what TV channel is it on?**
England is set to face France in the Six Nations Championship at the Allianz Stadium, with kick-off at 4:45pm GMT on Saturday, February 8. England's team has been reshuffled, with Marcus Smith moving to full-back and Fin Smith making his maiden Test start at fly-half. France, inspired by Antoine Dupont, has cruised to a record opening Six Nations victory against Wales. The match will be broadcast on ITV1, with Eddie Jones as the star pundit. England's last title was in 2020, while France won the title in 2022. The two teams have a history of close matches, including a last-gasp defeat for England in Paris in 2024.

The France national rugby team, led by Fabien Galthié, will face England at Twickenham Stadium on Saturday, February 8, 2025, in the second match of the 2025 Six Nations Championship. The French team has been in good form, having defeated Wales 43-0 in their first match. However, England has also been strong, with Marcus Smith set to start at fly-half. The French team's composition is similar to the one that won their first match, with Damian Penaud returning to the starting lineup and Matthieu Jalibert replacing Romain Ntamack, who is suspended for three weeks. Antoine Dupont will be the team's captain. The match will be refereed by Nika Amashukeli, a Georgian referee who has previously officiated several high-profile matches, including France's win over Scotland in 2023 and their narrow victory over New Zealand in November 2024. **Six Nations Championship 2025: Predictions for the Second Round**
The Six Nations Championship 2025 continues with three exciting matches this weekend. The first match is between Italy and Wales in Rome, where Italy is expected to be the favorite. However, Wales is determined to prove themselves and make a comeback. The second match is between England and France in London, where France is looking to bounce back from their loss to Ireland last week. England is expected to put up a good fight, but France has the stars in their lineup. The third match is between Scotland and Ireland in Edinburgh, where Scotland is looking to take advantage of Ireland's absence of their head coach Andy Farrell, who is on a British & Irish Lions mission. Scotland is expected to win with a narrow margin, according to the Edinburgh Evening News. 'It will be a tough match for Italy, they will have to work hard to win, and Wales will do everything to save their dignity. Remember, most people predicted Italy's win in Rome last year, but look what happened (17:29 in favor of Wales). Although they are the favorites now, it's hard to imagine Italy running away with a big score in this match. The hosts should win, but will it be a comfortable victory, only time will tell. And you can be sure that Wales will want to prove to many people that they were wrong.' 'France had a thrashing of the Welsh in Paris, but the trip to Twickenham is a different level, even against England, who is expected to not 'shine' on this tournament. The French will be without the disqualified Romain Ntamack. Although they have many options to compensate for this loss, it adds another name to their list of absent stars who would have otherwise been in the starting lineup.' 'It will be a thrilling match. England had some good moments in Dublin, and they earned a bonus point, but their game in the first and second half was like day and night. And it won't be unfair to say that, based on the second 40 minutes, they got lucky to finish the match with a relatively small defeat. Steve Borthwick will have to make some important changes. The match should be exciting.' 'Scotland will not get an easy win, they will have to work hard, and Wales will do everything to save their dignity. Remember, most people predicted Italy's win in Rome last year, and look what happened (17:29 in favor of Wales).

**Six Nations 2025: Calendar, Results, and Standings**
The Six Nations 2025 rugby tournament will take place from January 31 to March 15, 2025. The six participating teams are England, Wales, Scotland, Ireland, France, and Italy. The tournament has a annual schedule and is in its 26th edition with the 6-team format. The calendar is very tight, with each team playing a home and away match, alternating between even and odd years. The team that wins the Six Nations is the one that accumulates the most points in the standings, using a unique system called the 'Southern Hemisphere System'. For each win, 4 points are awarded, 2 for a draw, and 0 for a loss. Additionally, 1 bonus point is awarded to the losing team if the difference is less than 7 points, and to each team that scores at least 4 tries. A further 3 points are awarded to the team that wins all matches, guaranteeing them the tournament win. The current champion is Ireland, which has also won the most tournaments in the last 10 years. Italy has never won the tournament and often ends up with 0 points, earning the 'wooden spoon' award. Italy's first match is against Scotland, but attention is focused on the England-Ireland derby.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: To estimate the initial distribution, I start with the historical performance of each team in the Six Nations Championship over the last decade. Based on the frequency of wins: France and Ireland have been consistently strong performers, England also has a good history, Wales has had some strong years, while Scotland and Italy have historically been less dominant. This gives a preliminary sense of probabilities based on past performance.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Team Form and Injuries
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Ireland has had a consistently strong team and fewer major injuries reported recently. France also exhibits good form, while England has shown inconsistencies.
